data.title: Sheldon Reynolds obituary
data.meta_description: When not playing guitar with some of the biggest names in black music, Sheldon Reynolds was a contributing editor to the magazine Astronomy and his consuming pa
data.text:
When not playing guitar with some of the biggest names in black music, Sheldon Reynolds was a contributing editor to the magazine Astronomy and his consuming passion was gazing at the skies through his telescope and photographing the stars and planets.

Perhaps his interest in the extra-terrestrial was piqued by the years he spent playing with Earth, Wind & Fire, the funk band whose flamboyant, sci-fi-themed live shows were described by one critic as “Disneyland-on-Mars” and involved the group arriving on stage in a spaceship.

As a member of the group that he had revered since his early teens, Reynolds never stopped pinching himself, not quite able to believe that his heroes had become his bandmates. “If I’d only been able to play with them
